abstract: Accesses the particular container value associated with a custom key.

declaration.code: subscript<Key>(key: Key.Type) -> Key.Value where Key : ContainerValueKey { get set }

overview:
## Overview

Create a custom container value by declaring a new property in an extension to the container values structure and applying the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Entry()] macro to the variable declaration:

You use custom container values the same way you use system-provided values, setting a value with the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/containerValue(_:_:)] view modifier, and reading values from a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Subview] provided by the `subviews` modifier. You can also provide a dedicated view modifier as a convenience for setting the value:
title: subscript(_:)
